alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 10:59PM CDT until May 03 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... White Oak Creek Near Talco affecting Morris, Franklin and Titus Counties. For the White Oak Creek...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT TO LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Oak Creek Near Talco. * WHEN...From late Sunday night to late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of creek bottoms. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the creek bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Monday morning to a crest of 16.5 feet Monday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 06/12/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Saturday evening at 1100 PM CDT.
